1.english: Now after the Sabbath, as it began to dawn on the first day of the week, Mary Magdalene and the other Mary came to see the tomb.
1.wedau: ina marana muriyai  sabate  tauna [began] da [dawn] au  naona mara ana  [week] Mary [magdalene] ma  ghehauna Mary neꞌi da inana  [tomb]

2.english: Behold, there was a great earthquake, for an angel of the Lord descended from the sky, and came and rolled away the stone from the door, and sat on it.
2.wedau: [behold] kampa   ghe vavahagha [earthquake] yamna [an] [angel] ana  Guyau ghaꞌiraꞌi au  [sky] ma neꞌi ma [rolled] [away]  [stone] au  naona ma [sat] au tauna

3.english: His appearance was like lightning, and his clothing white as snow.

4.english: For fear of him, the guards shook, and became like dead men.

5.english: The angel answered the women, “Don’t be afraid, for I know that you seek Jesus, who has been crucified.
5.wedau: [angel] [answered]  vaivinehi [“don’t]  [afraid] yamna tau haramaneꞌi raketana omi [seek] Yesu aiyai ana  [crucified]
5.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.70); Strong secondary: Love

6.english: He is not here, for he has risen, just like he said. Come, see the place where the Lord was lying.
6.wedau: tauna  egha ina yamna tauna ana [risen] tagotagogi [like] tauna riwa neꞌi inana  gabu aiwaꞌi  Guyau  enoeno
6.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.70); Strong secondary: Love

7.english: Go quickly and tell his disciples, ‘He has risen from the dead, and behold, he goes before you into Galilee; there you will see him.’ Behold, I have told you.”
7.wedau: nae [quickly] ma riwehi ana tauvotaghotagho [‘he] ana [risen] au  [dead] ma [behold] tauna nae naona omi au [galilee;] kampa omi ina inana [him’] [behold] tau ana riwehi [you”]

8.english: They departed quickly from the tomb with fear and great joy, and ran to bring his disciples word.
8.wedau: tauhi [departed] [quickly] au  [tomb] maitehi [fear] ma ghe vavahagha [joy] ma [ran] da [bring] ana tauvotaghotagho riwana

9.english: As they went to tell his disciples, behold, Jesus met them, saying, “Rejoice!” They came and took hold of his feet, and worshiped him.
9.wedau: tauhi nae da riwehi ana tauvotaghotagho [behold] Yesu [met] hita riwa ipa [“rejoice!”] tauhi neꞌi ma varahai [hold] ana ana [feet] ma [worshiped] tauna

10.english: Then Jesus said to them, “Don’t be afraid. Go tell my brothers that they should go into Galilee, and there they will see me.”
10.wedau: maratagogi Yesu riwa da hita [“don’t]  [afraid] nae riwehi au tevera raketana tauhi ina nae au galili ma kampa tauhi ina inana [me”]

11.english: Now while they were going, behold, some of the guards came into the city, and told the chief priests all the things that had happened.
11.wedau: ina marana [while] tauhi  nae [behold] ghehauhi ana  [guards] neꞌi au  meyagaihi ma riwehi  [chief] pirisina anatapuhi  [things] raketana ana [happened]

12.english: When they were assembled with the elders, and had taken counsel, they gave a large amount of silver to the soldiers,
12.wedau: maranaina tauhi  [assembled] maitehi  [elders] ma ana varahai [counsel] tauhi verei  [large] [amount] ana [silver] da  [soldiers]

13.english: saying, “Say that his disciples came by night, and stole him away while we slept.
13.wedau: riwa ipa [“say] raketana ana tauvotaghotagho neꞌi au diedie ma [stole] tauna [away] [while] ita [slept]

14.english: If this comes to the governor’s ears, we will persuade him and make you free of worry.”
14.wedau: tora ina neꞌi da  [governor’s] [ears] ita ina [persuade] tauna ma rura omi [free] ana [worry”]

15.english: So they took the money and did as they were told. This saying was spread abroad among the Jews, and continues until today.
15.wedau: yamna tauhi varahai  [money] ma rura  tauhi  riwehi ina riwa ipa  howai [abroad] [among]  [jews] ma [continues] [until] [today]

16.english: But the eleven disciples went into Galilee, to the mountain where Jesus had sent them.
16.wedau: tuna  [eleven] tauvotaghotagho nae au galili da  dobuna aiwaꞌi Yesu ana vivohi hita

17.english: When they saw him, they bowed down to him, but some doubted.
17.wedau: maranaina tauhi inana tauna tauhi [bowed] au da tauna tuna ghehauhi [doubted]

18.english: Jesus came to them and spoke to them, saying, “All authority has been given to me in heaven and on earth.
18.wedau: Yesu neꞌi da hita ma [spoke] da hita riwa ipa [“all] rewapana ana  verei da tau au marei ma au dobuna
18.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.70); Strong secondary: Love

19.english: Go and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit,
19.wedau: nae ma rura tauvotaghotagho ana anatapuhi [nations] bababataitohi hita au  wava ana  Tamatei ma ana  natuna ma ana  [holy] aruwa
19.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.88); High harmony verse (balanced); Strong secondary: Love

20.english: teaching them to observe all things that I commanded you. Behold, I am with you always, even to the end of the age.” Amen.
20.wedau: viharaharamana hita da [observe] anatapuhi [things] raketana tau ririweiya omi [behold] tau [am] maitehi omi [always] ma da  [end] ana  [age”] [amen]
